items.content_html:

items.title: nixos/xdg/mime: support glob

items.content_html:
"mimi" provides a replacement for xdg-open with different runtime dependencies than xdg-utils' canonical version, so resholve was (rightly) objecting to the difference.

Closes #316399.

Description of changes

  • update mimisrc and simplify meta.license since mimi has adopted MIT in march-linux/mimi@c5ad45e
  • provide separate solution for resholve when mimiSupport is enabled
  • add a test for mimiSupport to make it easier to avoid future breaks

This shouldn't trigger rebuilds since mimiSupport isn't enabled by default. nixpkgs-review on both Linux and macOS shows Nothing to be built.

You can confirm on a checkout with nix-build -A xdg-utils.tests.mimiSupport.

items.title: nixos/xdg/*: disable by default

items.content_html:
Description of changes

The sway module already sets a default portal configuration to fallback on the gtk one for things that the wlr portal cannot do (see the archwiki for the relevant table). This change makes it actually add the gtk portal so this configuration is functional.

PS: if this constitutes a release change let me know !

items.title: xdg-desktop-portal: fix build when doCheck = false

items.content_html:
Ref: NixOS/nix#5588

This searches in $XDG_DATA_HOME/nix/profile everywhere where
previously we only looked in ~/.nix-profile, ditto for
.nix-channels and .nix-defexpr. This shouldn't break any
compatibility for now. It is highly recommended to use nixpkgs with
these changes if you want to use Nix with the XDG basedir PR, but not
doing so shouldn't result in any dramatic breakage -- in fact, NixOS
is perfectly usable without any user profile.

items.title: nixos/portals: point $XDG_DESKTOP_PORTAL_DIR at the current system

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Currently

nix shell github:NixOS/nixpkgs/nixos-unstable#xdg-user-dirs --command sh -c "man xdg-user-dirs-update"

--set NAME PATH
   Sets the XDG user dir with the given name.

   NAME should be one of the following:

       PATH must be an absolute path, e.g.  $HOME/Some/Directory.

Now, it's correctly rendered:

nix shell github:iFreilicht/nixpkgs/xdg-user-dirs-fix#xdg-user-dirs --command sh -c "man xdg-user-dirs-update"

--set NAME PATH
   Sets the XDG user dir with the given name.

   NAME should be one of the following:
       DESKTOP
       DOWNLOAD
       TEMPLATES
       PUBLICSHARE
       DOCUMENTS
       MUSIC
       PICTURES
       VIDEOS

   PATH must be an absolute path, e.g.  $HOME/Some/Directory.

Also migrated to by-name.

    • aarch64-linux
